proposals.job_title: Salesforce and Jira Integration Specialist Needed
proposals.description: We are looking for an experienced professional to assist with integrating Salesforce and Jira. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of both platforms and how to facilitate seamless data transfer and communication between them. You will be responsible for mapping out integration requirements, implementing the necessary configurations, and ensuring that both systems work harmoniously together. If you have experience in API integrations and can troubleshoot issues effectively, we wa...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Seamless data transfer and communication between them" – that's music to my ears! I understand the frustration that comes with manually juggling data between Salesforce and Jira. I once spent a week untangling a spaghetti-like integration someone *thought* was seamless. Lesson learned: proper planning is key.

For your project, I'd start by mapping out those specific data points you need synced and the direction it should flow. Then, I'll configure the connection itself, using webhooks or middleware (depending on your preference and budget). Finally, thorough testing is crucial.

Would you be available for a quick chat to discuss your specific requirements and workflow in more detail? I'm happy to share some ideas.

proposals.job_title: Zapier Expert for Salesforce Workflows
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced AI and Zapier expert to set up efficient workflows within Salesforce and other platforms. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of automation tools and how to integrate them with Salesforce to enhance our sales processes. You will be responsible for creating and optimizing workflows that streamline our operations, improve data management, and enhance productivity. If you have a proven track record in this area, we want to hear from you!
proposals.message:
---

Hi there,

Saw you're looking to smooth out some Salesforce workflows with Zapier, specifically around integration challenges. I totally get that. I spent a frustrating week last year debugging a similar situation where a custom Salesforce object just refused to play nice with a lead generation tool – turns out it was a mismatched field name that was causing all the headaches.

For your project, I'd start by mapping out your current Salesforce processes, identifying those integration bottlenecks. Then, we can look at building some Zapier flows to bridge the gaps, focusing on data accuracy and efficiency. Finally, I can help you test and refine those flows to make sure everything's running smoothly.

Would love to chat briefly about your specific needs and see if I can offer some helpful ideas. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime next week.
---

proposals.job_title: 🚀 Senior Svelte Developer (Frontend - Tables & Dynamic UI)
proposals.description:
Join Outbond, a fast-growing AI startup building the future of outbound prospecting. We’re looking for a senior Svelte developer who thrives on clean code, beautiful UI, and solving real user problems.

You’ll work on dynamic grid/table views, interactive components, and AI-driven interfaces used by sales teams around the world.

✅ What We’re Looking For:
3+ years of Svelte experience (incl. SvelteKit)

Strong skills in table/grid-based UIs and component architecture

Pixel-perfect execution fro...
proposals.message:
Hey Outbond Team,

Saw you're looking for someone to build "dynamic grid/table views and AI-driven interfaces" – that really caught my eye. I remember wrestling with complex data grids in Svelte a couple of years back for a logistics company. It taught me the crucial importance of component reusability and performant data binding from the get-go.

For your project, I'd focus on first nailing down the data structure for the tables, then building highly adaptable Svelte components with clear separation of concerns, and finally, integrating those components with your AI-driven logic. That modular approach tends to pay dividends down the line in terms of maintainability.

Would love to chat more about the specifics of your data and UI requirements. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Expert Needed to Integrate Calendly with Webflow
proposals.description:
We are seeking an expert to seamlessly integrate Calendly with our Webflow website.  We would like to launch the Calendly calender after demo request form submission using Calendly's routing tool that integrations with the Hubspot Form we're using. 

This should be a very simple project for a webflow developer who has experience with Calendly. 

The ideal candidate will have in-depth knowledge of both platforms, ensuring that our scheduling functionality operates smoothly and enhances user exper...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Integration challenges" - I hear you loud and clear! I've tackled similar Calendly/Webflow setups where getting the data flow right after form submissions can be a bit tricky. Once I spent an entire day troubleshooting why Hubspot wasn't triggering Calendly routing, turns out it was a single misconfigured field mapping. Super frustrating!

For your project, I'd start by carefully reviewing your Hubspot form and how it's connected to Calendly routing. Then, I'd set up a test environment in Webflow to mirror your live site and ensure the integration works perfectly. Finally, we'll deploy it to your live site, testing everything thoroughly.

Would love to chat for 15 minutes and see if my experience aligns well with your specific needs.

proposals.job_title: AI-Powered Virtual Staging Web App (Image Upload → Room Staging → Delivery)
proposals.description:
Job Description: I'm looking for an experienced full stack developer to build a fully automated virtual staging platform for virtual staging. For own faster operations we need a system like the following.

The user flow is simple:
1. We upload a real estate photo (empty room)
2. Selects room type (bedroom, kitchen, etc.)
3. Selects desired furniture style (e.g., Modern, Scandinavian)
4. Receive a staged version of the photo within ~10 minutes (automatically)


You can leverage AI APIs like Repli...
proposals.message:
Hey there! The idea of automating the whole virtual staging process "for faster operations" definitely resonates with me. I've seen firsthand how tedious manual staging can be – spent a few too many late nights myself moving digital furniture in past projects!

For something like this, I'd first focus on nailing the image upload/AI API integration (Repli sounds good!). Then, we'd prioritize getting that core staging loop working reliably. Finally, polish the user experience with intuitive selection and styling options. Keeps things manageable and gets you results quickly.

If you'd like to chat more about the specifics, I'm always up for a virtual coffee!

proposals.job_title: Python Developer - Part Time Remote Position
proposals.description:
About Us 
-----------
Teammate AI is revolutionizing how businesses implement AI solutions. We're focused on making AI technology accessible and practical, helping organizations automate tasks and scale their impact. Our infrastructure needs to be as innovative as our solutions. 

The Role 
-----------
We're seeking a skilled Python Developer to join our remote team, focusing on building and maintaining our AI automation platforms. This role offers the flexibility of part-time hours with the pot...
proposals.message:
Hey Teammate AI Team,

Read your description about needing help building and maintaining your AI automation platforms – resonates with me! I spent a good chunk of last year untangling a knot of integration issues for a marketing startup that was drowning in disconnected AI tools. It was a mess, but taught me the importance of rock-solid backend architecture.

For your situation, I'd suggest first focusing on a clear API strategy to ensure smooth data flow. Then, we could build out robust unit tests for each automated function to catch errors early. Finally, I'd suggest creating detailed documentation to help maintain your code long-term.

Would love to chat about the specific tech stack you're using and how I can help make your AI platforms even more impactful. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Founder Associate – Business, Content & Ops 🇻🇳
proposals.description:
# 🙋‍♀️ what’s the job?

/// Remote-first (Vietnam time), async-friendly

Tocco is building the operating system for future materials — a platform where designers, buyers, and makers discover and use radically better materials.

We’ve launched. The users are real. The product is live. The mission is clear.

Now we’re looking for a **Founder Associate, based in Vietnam** (or **APAC**) who thrives in ambiguity, acts fast, and turns loose ideas into systems, content, and real product delivery — a sh...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Turning loose ideas into systems" - that really resonated with me. I've spent the last few years helping solo founders and small teams wrangle exactly that kind of chaos into something manageable through automation. I remember once helping a founder who was spending *hours* each week just copy-pasting data between spreadsheets and their CRM; we streamlined it with a simple Zapier integration and gave them back almost a full day.

For Tocco, especially with the emphasis on content and ops, I'd think about initially mapping out your key workflows, identifying the repetitive tasks, and then building out lightweight automations to handle them. Maybe starting with lead qualification or content distribution?

Would love to chat more about your specific pain points and explore some quick wins. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: AI agents expert to create simple AI assistants using ChatGPT
proposals.description:
Hi,

we're looking for an AI agents expert to:

- create AI assistants from scratch based on requirements
- customize existing AI assistants 
- create end-to-end process & SOP for the given task
- knowledge of Zapier is a big plus

If you check all of these boxes, you're welcome to apply.

Thanks
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Creating AI assistants from scratch based on requirements" is exactly the kind of thing I enjoy. I remember once spending a week wrestling with a particularly stubborn API while building a lead generation assistant – felt like I was speaking a different language from the AI! Eventually, we got it humming, and the client saved hours a week.

For your project, I'd first want to fully understand your specific needs for each AI assistant. Then, I'd focus on building robust, easily maintainable solutions, making sure to document everything in a clear SOP. I'd then integrate the assistants with Zapier if needed to streamline your workflows.

Would love to chat briefly about your requirements and see if I can bring my experience to bear.

Best,
Timothy

proposals.job_title: Android Developer
proposals.description:
Looking for an Android developer to join the team!

Requirements:

2+ years of Android development experience.

Knowledge of Kotlin/Java.

Work with Android SDK, Jetpack Components (Room, ViewModel, Coroutines).

Experience with REST API, Retrofit, OkHttp.

Understanding of Clean Architecture, MVVM/MVI principles.

Ability to work with Git.
proposals.message:
Hi there,

I noticed you're looking to "join the team" with an Android developer – always a good sign when collaboration is valued! I've been doing solo freelance automation work for about 20 years now. I remember early on, wrestling with manual deployments that kept me up all night – it's a painful way to spend your time.

For this project, I'd suggest initially focusing on a streamlined API integration using Retrofit and Kotlin Coroutines, then refactoring for a solid MVVM structure, and finally, setting up a robust Git workflow for smoother team contributions.

Would you be open to a quick chat to discuss the specific architectural needs of your project and how we could tackle this?

proposals.job_title: Zapier and CRM automation specialist needed for marketing funnels implementation
proposals.description:
We have an E-Commerce site and we need automations to trigger and send Emails and notifications to multiple channels for internal reporting for all the usual commerce events like product view, abandonment, order completion.

The ideal candidate needs to have a strong understanding of automations using ActiveCampaign, Zapier and WooCommerce.

Understanding of webhooks and API integrations is a plus.

Potential for long term opportunity.
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Automations to trigger and send Emails and notifications for all the usual commerce events" - I get it. The manual process of keeping track of everything in an e-commerce business is a nightmare!

I remember helping a small online bookstore a few years ago. They were manually pulling sales data from WooCommerce into a spreadsheet every week. We set up a Zapier integration that automated the process, and they freed up hours each week.

For your project, I'd suggest starting with mapping out your current workflows and identifying the key data points you want to track. Then, we can design the Zaps to connect WooCommerce, ActiveCampaign, and your internal reporting channels. Finally, we'll implement the webhooks and API integrations needed for those events and notifications.

Would you be open to a quick chat to discuss your specific needs? No pressure, just want to make sure I'm the right fit.

proposals.job_title: Build Chatbot running Locally on LLM - With proven experience only
proposals.description: I'm looking for an experienced chatbot developer to build a custom AI chatbot for hotel customer support, handling pre- and post-booking questions (availability, check-in/out, amenities, etc.). The bot will be based on an existing tool but fully customized and run on a local LLM (not API-based). Only apply if you have proven experience building and deploying chatbots (please share real examples), ideally using tools like LangChain, RAG pipelines, or LocalAI. Experience with hotels, multilingual ...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

I saw you're looking to build a custom chatbot to handle hotel customer support questions locally, which makes total sense considering the amount of time manual processes can soak up.

I remember a project last year where a similar business was drowning in repetitive inquiries; implementing a localized LLM chatbot freed up their staff significantly, allowing them to focus on personalized guest experiences.

For your project, I'd propose starting with a deep dive into your existing customer support data to identify key question patterns. Then, we can leverage that to customize a LangChain-based chatbot using LocalAI, ensuring it accurately handles availability, check-in, and other common queries in multiple languages. Finally, we'll thoroughly test and fine-tune the model.

If you're open to a quick chat about how to approach this, I'd be happy to discuss your requirements in detail.

proposals.job_title: Website/WordPress/WooCommerce/Square Expert Needed, Translation, Upload & Cart Flow Improvements
proposals.description:
I run a fashion e-commerce store built with WordPress and WooCommerce, hosted on IONOS. The site is styled to resemble Zara and needs to be finalized.
Most work was previously done, but due to a backup issue, progress after May 5 has been lost. I’ve restored images, but updates completed up to May 30, including product descriptions, checkout flow, and static pages wich must be redone.

I have all the content and a video recording of the previous workflow so it will be simple to have a crystal cl...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Progress after May 5 has been lost…updates completed up to May 30...must be redone." Ouch, that's a tough spot! I had a similar issue once with a client migrating to a new server – lost a ton of custom CSS changes right before launch. Learned my lesson about offsite backups *real* quick!

Looking at your situation, I'd tackle it in three stages: first, a careful review of your video to get a clear picture of the lost work. Second, systematically rebuild the content, checkout flow, and static pages. Finally, thorough testing to ensure everything's running smoothly before you go live again.

Would you be open to a quick chat so I can better understand your vision for the site? I can take a look at the recording and give you an idea of timeline and pricing.

proposals.job_title: Mobile App Developer ( proficient both IOS and Android)
proposals.description:
Job Description:
- Perform periodic testing and improve the usability of the mobile app
- Build the design interface as per the client’s needs
Fix bugs and other performance issues as an iOS and Android mobile developer
- Develop new features as a mobile software developer.
Communicate with the users to understand their exact requirements
- Translate code to create dynamic, functional and relevant mobile apps
- Manage, maintain and improve the application as a mobile app developer
-Write and exe...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to "fix bugs and other performance issues" and generally improve the app. Been there! I remember one time, a tiny, almost invisible memory leak was driving users crazy. Turns out, it was a poorly optimized image caching function. Little gremlins, those things.

For this, I'd start with a deep dive into your app's analytics and crash reports to identify the biggest friction points. Then, I'd implement a rigorous testing and debugging cycle, working closely with you on design improvements. Finally, I can handle writing the executables so that everything flows.

If you're open to chatting more about your mobile app, I'd be happy to jump on a quick call to discuss your overall vision and goals for the app.

proposals.job_title: Product Engineer – Growth & Automation 🤖
proposals.description:
# 🙋‍♀️ what’s the job?

/// please note that this job is only for Vietnam/Malalysia-based candidates ///

Tocco was born in 2022 to reimagine how we produce, not just how we consume. We’re building a B2B platform to make sustainable sourcing radically accessible — combining the most extensive alt-materials database with the tools and editorial context that make it actually usable.

We’ve launched [tocco.earth](https://www.tocco.earth/), users are onboarding, and systems are growing fast.

Now we...
proposals.message:
Hey there! "Automation needs" jumped out at me in your description. I completely get it. As systems grow, those manual processes quickly become a bottleneck.

I remember one time helping a small e-commerce business struggling with order fulfillment – they were spending hours each day just copying and pasting data between platforms. We ended up automating their entire workflow with a few custom scripts, and it freed up their team to focus on marketing.

For Tocco, I'd suggest starting with a quick audit of your current processes to identify the biggest time-sinks. Then, we could prioritize automating those areas, focusing first on integrations between your database and user onboarding. Finally, we would set up monitoring so you can track the improvements.

If you're interested in exploring some initial ideas, I'd be happy to chat for a few minutes about your specific challenges.

proposals.job_title: Google Actions Center
proposals.description:
We’re seeking an experienced developer to assist with the final setup and configuration of our platform’s integration with Google’s Actions Center for Reservations. 

This is a focused, short-term project ideal for a seasoned developer with direct experience in working with Google’s Action Center and secure data transfer workflows.

Project Details:
You will collaborate with our veteran development team, who has already created the required JSON file structure. Your role will be to validate the ...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

So you're looking for someone to validate the Action Center integration – makes sense. Getting the final setup right is always crucial. I remember once spending a whole afternoon debugging a similar reservation setup where a tiny formatting error in the JSON was causing bookings to silently fail. Drove me nuts!

I'd suggest we first run a quick validation check on your JSON file to ensure it adheres to the expected schema. Then, we can move on to testing the actual data transfer workflow with Google's tools. Finally, some thorough testing of the reservation process with a range of data inputs (as always) is always a must.

Would be happy to hop on a quick call to chat through the specifics of your JSON structure and how your team has approached the project so far. Let me know if you're free sometime next week?

proposals.job_title: Looking for Experienced Unity Developer for Base-Building PvP/PvE Mobile Game
proposals.description:
Hi there! 

I’m looking for a developer who can help me build a mobile strategy game (for both Android and iOS) similar to Clash of Clans, Kingshot, Lords Mobile, and other games in that style.

My idea is to start by purchasing an existing Unity-based game template or source code and then customize and build upon it to create something unique.

The game should include core features common to this genre, such as:
	•	Base building and resource management (gold, wood, elixir, etc.)
	•	PvE missions...
proposals.message:
Hey there! Saw you're aiming to customize a Unity template for your base-building game – smart move! I’ve been down that road a few times. One project involved tweaking a similar template, and honestly, getting the resource balancing right was a real challenge initially; almost broke the gameplay loop!

For your project, I’d suggest starting with a deep dive into a few template options to nail down the perfect fit, then we’d focus on customizing those core features, like the resource management, to ensure they are rock solid from the get-go. PvE missions could then be integrated and tested to ensure they align with the core game loop.

If you’d like to chat more about your specific vision and how we could tackle this, I'm happy to hop on a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Klaviyo Email Marketing Expert Needed
proposals.description:
We're seeking an experienced Klaviyo specialist to optimize our email marketing campaigns and increase revenue for our ecommerce business. You'll set up automated flows, create engaging campaigns, and implement segmentation strategies.

Key Responsibilities

-Build and optimize email automation flows (welcome, abandoned cart, post-purchase, win-back)
-Create high-converting email campaigns and newsletters
-Implement advanced customer segmentation and A/B testing
-Monitor performance metrics and ...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

I noticed you're looking to optimize your email automation flows - especially the welcome, abandoned cart, post-purchase, and win-back. I get it, those are crucial touchpoints.

A while back, I worked with an online retailer whose abandoned cart flow was technically *working*, but it was just… bland. We dove into their branding and infused some personality. Turns out, a little humor and personalized product recommendations worked wonders.

For you, I'd start by auditing your current flows for areas of improvement. Then, based on that data, we'll prioritize building out high-converting email content, incorporating segmentation strategies to boost personalization.

I'm always happy to chat about your specific needs and if you think I'm the right fit for this project. Feel free to shoot me a message.

proposals.job_title: AI Visual Director – Cinematic Imagery, Motion Editing & Brand Storytelling
proposals.description:
We’re hiring a top-tier AI visual artist + motion editor to deliver a complete 100-asset visual campaign for a poetic luxury brand.
You will own the creation of 50 polished brand-level images and 50 cinematic short videos, including real product integration, AI-built worlds, and ad-ready delivery.

This is not content. This is mythmaking through design.

Total Deliverables: 100 Visual Assets
• 50 editorial-grade images
• Created in Midjourney v6 (or equivalent)
• Enhanced, color-balanced, 4K-rea...
proposals.message:
Okay, here’s that proposal, aimed at sounding authentically like me:

"Mythmaking through design," huh? I love that. I've spent years automating content creation, and the biggest hurdle is always translating the *feeling* a brand wants to evoke into something a machine can understand and replicate. It's more than just prompts.

I recently worked on a project where the client kept saying, "It needs more soul." We ended up using mood boards and reference videos alongside the AI prompts, a visual language bridge that really helped.

For your project, I'd suggest starting with a deep dive into your brand's poetic core, creating that visual language guide. Then, we can translate that into detailed Midjourney prompts, ensuring real product integration. Finally, it's all about the cinematic polish in post – color balancing and resolution bump.

Does that resonate? I'd be happy to chat more about your vision and how we can make it happen.

proposals.job_title: GoHighLevel Funnel & Automation Specialist (Part-Time, Startup Agency – Dutch Market)
proposals.description:
I run a startup marketing agency focused on helping Dutch service-based businesses grow through funnels, automation, and ads. We’re looking for a GoHighLevel (GHL) specialist to assist with the technical backend — building funnels, setting up automations, and onboarding clients into GHL.

⚠️ Note: This is a behind-the-scenes role — you won’t have any client communication. You’ll work directly with me, and I’ll handle client contact.

We’re starting at ~5 hours per week, with a strong possibility...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to help with the GHL backend, building funnels and automations for your Dutch clients, especially to get away from manual processes. I get it! I remember helping a local cleaning business completely revamp their lead follow-up in GHL. Before, they were drowning in spreadsheets; now, it's all automated, and they actually have time to focus on cleaning!

For your agency, my approach would be to first deeply understand your specific funnel/automation needs per client. Then, I'd build out those flows within GHL, focusing on clean, scalable architecture. Finally, I'd create documentation and training materials specifically tailored for your team so you can confidently manage things down the line.

I'm definitely interested in chatting more about how I can help. Let me know when you might be free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Full Stack Web Developer (Angular / PHP / Python)
proposals.description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced Full Stack Web Developer with strong proficiency in Angular for frontend development, and PHP and Python for backend development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, pixel perfect developing, testing, and maintaining scalable.

Requirements:
- Proven experience developing web website with Angular (v14+).
- Strong proficiency in PHP and Python, with experience in at least one major framework for each.
- Solid understanding of FastAPIs a...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to tackle full-stack development, especially to get your Angular frontend humming while also leveraging PHP and Python. The mention of needing to build scalable sites really resonated with me. I spent a good chunk of last year untangling a similar project where the initial architecture just couldn't handle peak loads, resulting in a lot of late nights and frantic database tweaks.

To avoid that for you, I'd suggest first really mapping out the expected traffic and data flow, then building out a robust API layer (thinking FastAPI here would be ideal) connected to a scalable backend. Finally, tying that seamlessly to the Angular front-end.

Would love to chat more about the specific requirements and how we can future-proof the project. Let me know if you're open to a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Android Developer
proposals.description:
Looking for an Android developer to join the team!

Requirements:

2+ years of Android development experience.

Knowledge of Kotlin/Java.

Work with Android SDK, Jetpack Components (Room, ViewModel, Coroutines).

Early in my automation career, I spent a month debugging an app that was constantly crashing because of a simple, manually updated configuration file. proposals.job_title: Kajabi Expert Needed for Course Creation and Management
proposals.description: We are looking for a skilled Kajabi expert to help us create and manage online courses. proposals.message:
Hey there,

Reading your description, especially where you mention needing help with course creation and management inside Kajabi, really resonated with me. I remember a similar situation a few years back with a client selling photography courses. They were drowning in manual enrollment and payment tracking.

Based on your needs, my initial approach would be to first get a handle on your existing Kajabi setup. proposals.job_title: Automate Customer Invoice Generation for T-Shirt Business
proposals.description: I am seeking a skilled developer to create a program or interface that integrates with QuickBooks to automate the process of generating customer invoices for my t-shirt business. This solution should streamline invoicing, reduce manual entry errors, and enhance overall efficiency. The ideal candidate will have experience in QuickBooks integration and a strong understanding of invoicing processes. If you have the skills to create an effective automation tool, I would love to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Streamline invoicing, reduce manual entry errors, and enhance overall efficiency"—that really resonates with me. I remember helping a friend who ran a small bakery; she was spending hours each week just chasing invoices, and it was draining her.

For your t-shirt business, I'd first want to get a clear understanding of how your QuickBooks is set up and how you're currently handling order data. Then, we can explore the best way to automatically pull that data and generate those invoices—maybe a custom script or an integration using the QuickBooks API. Finally, we’d test it thoroughly to ensure accuracy.

If you're interested in chatting more about your specific workflow, I'm happy to hop on a quick call.

proposals.job_title: WordPress Web Designer - Focus on Visual Design & User Experience (German Speaking Preferred)

proposals.message:

For your site, I'd suggest starting with a quick audit of your current setup to pinpoint the biggest time drains. Then, we can explore some targeted plugin optimizations or even custom tweaks to streamline those workflows. And finally, let's optimize the UI design to be more user-friendly.

If you're open to a quick chat, I'd love to brainstorm some specific ideas based on what you've already built.

proposals.job_title: Full Stack Engineer Needed for Video Sharing Web App

The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience with the MERN stack and demonstrable expertise in configuring and managing TURN servers for optimal video streaming performance.

proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Integration challenges" and video streaming... that's always a fun puzzle! I remember helping a startup a few years back where their TURN server kept choking on even moderate traffic – turned out to be a subtle config issue with the firewall rules. Drove us nuts for a week!

proposals.job_title: Website Development for Men's Clothing Business

proposals.job_title: Fix Google Search Console Integration for Website Indexing
proposals.description:
We are looking for an experienced SEO professional to help resolve ongoing issues with Google Search Console.

🔧 The Problem:
Our website previously had a different URL structure. After redesigning and updating the page structure, we submitted new sitemaps. However, Google is still not indexing the new pages properly, and the old URLs continue to show errors and remain in the index.

✅ What We Need:
- Remove outdated/old pages from Google’s index.
- Ensure that all new pages listed in the curren...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Google is still not indexing the new pages properly" - I hear you loud and clear. Been there! I remember wrestling with a similar issue for a client after they migrated to a new CMS. Turns out, the old sitemap was still lingering and causing confusion.

Based on your description, I'd suggest:
1. A thorough audit of your sitemaps (both active and inactive) in Search Console, ensuring the old ones are removed.
2. Deep crawl of the website checking for stray internal links to old URL paths, also submitting the new site map.
3. Requesting a removal of the outdated URLs directly through Search Console.

It can be a bit of a detective game, but usually pretty straightforward. If you're up for a quick chat about how I approach this, let me know.

proposals.job_title: Emails going to spam
proposals.description:
Looking for someone who has actionable steps to take to help me with my email marketing sensibility.  My personal emails as well are now going to spam for no other reason then being associated with my other accounts that are not sending e-blasts.

The issue is my domain might have an issue.  Please reach out if you are an…
-expert in email sensibility.
-e-blasting and data mining is something I have already done.  I only need help fixing my email status.

proposals.message:

For you, I'd start by digging into your domain's reputation using a few key tools to see what blacklists you might be on. Then, we'd set up and thoroughly check your SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records – ensuring they're configured correctly is crucial. Finally, based on what we find, we can implement a warming strategy for your IP if needed and monitor the results closely.

If you're interested, I'm happy to hop on a quick call to discuss your specific setup and see if I can offer some concrete help.
